Line 79: Line 79:
In the early 2000s, [[Eon McKai]] was one of the filmmakers who spearheaded the [[alt porn]] subgenre.
In the early 2000s, [[Eon McKai]] was one of the filmmakers who spearheaded the [[alt porn]] subgenre.
  +   +
[[File:Tru- A XXX Parody.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Tru: A XXX Parody DVD box cover]]
In the early 2000s, parody films began to get much more attention, both within the adult film industry and also in the mainstream media. While they have always done parodies (e.g., one film in the early 1980s was called "8 to 4", a take-off on the film ''[[Nine to Five|9 to 5]]''), the current generation of spoofs aim for higher production values and scripts that more closely resemble the original source material.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118005547.html?categoryid=14&cs=1|title= Classic TV gets porn parody treatment|accessdate= 2010-06-13|author= Brian Lowry|date= 2009-06-30|publisher= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety)]]}}</ref> One of the first of these parodies to gain widespread mainstream attention was the film ''[[Who's Nailin' Paylin?]]'', about then-vice presidential candidate [[Sarah Palin]]. In early 2010 [[David Faustino]], one of the stars of the TV series ''[[Married... with Children]]'' visited the set of the parody ''Not Married with Children XXX 2'' who commented on how closely the porn set looked like the real thing saying "you guys really went all out".<ref>{{Cite web|url= http://www.lukeisback.com/?p=11623|title= David Faustino Drops by Will Ryder Set|work= lukeisback.com|accessdate= 2010-06-13|date= 2010-04-05}}</ref> Later that same year, [[Anna Paquin]] of the show ''[[True Blood]]'' commented about the [[Film trailer|trailer]] for the show's porn parody: "How funny is that? Someone brought their computer to set and we all watched the trailer for it. We all think it's hilarious!"<ref>{{Cite web|url= http://www.digitalspy.com/cult/s59/true-blood/news/a233102/paquin-true-blood-porn-is-hilarious.html|title= Paquin: 'True Blood porn is hilarious'|work= digitalspy.com|accessdate= 2010-06-25|author= Catriona Wightman|date= 2010-06-25}}</ref>
In the early 2000s, parody films began to get much more attention, both within the adult film industry and also in the mainstream media. While they have always done parodies (e.g., one film in the early 1980s was called "8 to 4", a take-off on the film ''[[Nine to Five|9 to 5]]''), the current generation of spoofs aim for higher production values and scripts that more closely resemble the original source material.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118005547.html?categoryid=14&cs=1|title= Classic TV gets porn parody treatment|accessdate= 2010-06-13|author= Brian Lowry|date= 2009-06-30|publisher= [[Variety (magazine)|Variety)]]}}</ref> One of the first of these parodies to gain widespread mainstream attention was the film ''[[Who's Nailin' Paylin?]]'', about then-vice presidential candidate [[Sarah Palin]]. In early 2010 [[David Faustino]], one of the stars of the TV series ''[[Married... with Children]]'' visited the set of the parody ''Not Married with Children XXX 2'' who commented on how closely the porn set looked like the real thing saying "you guys really went all out".<ref>{{Cite web|url= http://www.lukeisback.com/?p=11623|title= David Faustino Drops by Will Ryder Set|work= lukeisback.com|accessdate= 2010-06-13|date= 2010-04-05}}</ref> Later that same year, [[Anna Paquin]] of the show ''[[True Blood]]'' commented about the [[Film trailer|trailer]] for the show's porn parody: "How funny is that? Someone brought their computer to set and we all watched the trailer for it. We all think it's hilarious!"<ref>{{Cite web|url= http://www.digitalspy.com/cult/s59/true-blood/news/a233102/paquin-true-blood-porn-is-hilarious.html|title= Paquin: 'True Blood porn is hilarious'|work= digitalspy.com|accessdate= 2010-06-25|author= Catriona Wightman|date= 2010-06-25}}</ref>
